p: For decades, Liquid injectable silicone has been used for correction of contour defect or soft‐tissue augmentation. Medical‐grade liquid silicone (polydimethylsiloxane) becomes the preferred inert material for cosmetic purpose due to its durability, a lack of immunogenicity, and thermal stability; but later found to be associated with silicone embolism syndrome (SES). Liquid injectable silicone induced embolism has been reported by several studies as a cause of acute pneumonitis with alveolar haemorrhage 1, 2, 3.
